hiragana: あした、あす、みょうにち

english: bill [of money, e.g., a thousand-yen bill]

hiragana: チャック、ファスナー、ジッパー

english: this direction, thing, person, or place
that direction, thing, person, or place
that direction, thing, person, or place over there
which direction, thing, person, or place
width, breadth, free room, difference [between two substances]
to raise or extend one's hands
to be disturbed, to become confused
to grow cold, to get chilly, to cool down
to wake, to become sober, to be disillusioned
to harden, to solidify, to become firm
to be filled, to be surrounded, to overflow
to be buried, to be covered
to celebrate, to be jubilant, to have joy, to have delight, to have rapture

to partin, to separatein, to break upin
volitional ending [う for u-verbs, よう for ru-verbs]: "Let's…" or "I will"
causative ending [せる for u-verbs, させる for ru-verbs]: to make [someone do something], to allow
passive verb ending [れる for u-verbs, られる for ru-verbs]: to be <verbed> [e.g., 食べられる, "to be eaten"]
indicates that it seems the verb occurs [e.g., "It seems he ate"]
indicates that it seems the verb occurs; also used to ask whether the verb occurs

romaji: nai, n [ん is a slurred version and sounds a little masculine]

english: archaic informal negative ["he hath", "thou didst", etc.]

romaji: e) [Note: へ is normally read he, but when used as this particle its reading changes to e

english: things like <list of things>, including, such things as

romaji: tsutsu) [similar to ながら but has different tone, and both actions have equal weight

english: te form of verb or adjective [see explanation
emphasis and question marker, equivalent to "right?"
the copula particle used after quasi-adjectives
particle indicating that the speaker is trying to recall some information ["What class is next -kke?"]
particle used to indicate that what precedes it is an extreme example and strongly negates it)
